eu_initiatives:
Acted as a lead partner in a number SEUPB funded programmes on promoting reconciliation in NI Ireland and 6 Border counties with ROI. 
 
Administered Peace 2 funds on behalf of SEUPB
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: Co-operation Ireland is a peacebuilding charity working across the island of Ireland and between Britain and Ireland. Its mission is building mutual respect and understanding for mutual benefit. The organisation was founded in 1979 and has offices in Belfast and Dublin.
relevant_communication:
Currently administering 23 programmes across the island of Ireland mainly focused on reconciliation and tackling segregation. Many of the organisations programmes are focused on young people helping to develop their leadership skills.  On UN Internaional Peace Day last year Co-operation Ireland  brought 5000 young people to the Maze/Long Kesh (formerly used as a prison during the conflict) and also beamed in live young people from 22 others countries experiencing conflict around the world. 
 
Co-operation Ireland was also closely involved in the Queens first ever visit to the ROI and the first ever visit of the President of Ireland to Great Britain. 
 
As part of its peace work Co-operation Ireland also facilitated the historic handshake between the Queen and deputy First Minister Martin McGuiness.
legal_status: Registered Charity in NI and ROI
